section.title: Setting preferences via plugin_customization.ini
section.para: You can use a file to set the default values of preferences. The file which contains these defaults is typically named plugin_customization.ini .
Such a file needs to be registered via the preferenceCustomization property on the product extension point in the plugin.xml file. This is demonstrated in the following screenshot.

textobject.phrase: Referring to the plugin_customization.ini file in the product extension

section.para: The format to use is <plugin id>/<setting>=<value> , e.g. com.example.e4.rcp.todo/user=vogella .

tip.para: To find the correct keys, just start your Eclipse application, switch to the .metadata directory in your workspace directory (by default the directory your application is starting in) and search for files ending with .pref .
